physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At 7 years, the patient developed a goiter. Ultrasonography revealed multiple nodules within both lobes. At 9 years, a total thyroidectomy was performed due to the continued growth of the thyroid mass, identified as invasive follicular variant papillary thyroid carcinoma.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The goiter and nodules developed and progressed leading to total thyroidectomy and diagnosis of papillary thyroid carcinoma.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At 7 years, a clinically unsuspected thyroid nodule within the left lobe of the thyroid gland was detected and removed, confirming a diagnosis of follicular variant papillary thyroid carcinoma.
At 11.5 years, bilateral papillary thyroid carcinoma was diagnosed after removal of thyroid nodules detected on ultrasound.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The initial nodules progressed to a diagnosis of bilateral papillary thyroid carcinoma.
